Dagger PHP SDK

Namespaces

Dagger

  • Attribute
  • Dagger

Container extends AbstractObject implements IdAble

An OCI-compatible container, also known as a Docker container.

Table of Contents

Methods

Retrieves this container plus a file mounted at the given path.
withMountedSecret()  : Container
Retrieves this container plus a secret mounted into a file at the given path.
withMountedTemp()  : Container
Retrieves this container plus a temporary directory mounted at the given path. Any writes will be ephemeral to a single withExec call; they will not be persisted to subsequent withExecs.

Return a new container snapshot, with a file added to its filesystem with text content

Retrieves the working directory for all commands.

Methods

asService()

Turn the container into a Service.

public asService([array<string|int, mixed>|null $args = null ][, bool|null $useEntrypoint = false ][, bool|null $experimentalPrivilegedNesting = false ][, bool|null $insecureRootCapabilities = false ][, bool|null $expand = false ][, bool|null $noInit = false ]) : Service

Be sure to set any exposed ports before this conversion.

Parameters
$args : array<string|int, mixed>|null = null
$useEntrypoint : bool|null = false
$experimentalPrivilegedNesting : bool|null = false
$insecureRootCapabilities : bool|null = false
$expand : bool|null = false
$noInit : bool|null = false
Return values
Service

Package the container state as an OCI image, and return it as a tar archive

Parameters

$forcedCompression : ImageLayerCompression|null = null
$mediaTypes : ImageMediaTypes|null = null
Return values
File

experimentalWithAllGPUs()

EXPERIMENTAL API! Subject to change/removal at any time.

public experimentalWithAllGPUs() : Container

Configures all available GPUs on the host to be accessible to this container.

This currently works for Nvidia devices only.

Return values
Container

experimentalWithGPU()

EXPERIMENTAL API! Subject to change/removal at any time.

public experimentalWithGPU(array<string|int, mixed> $devices) : Container

Configures the provided list of devices to be accessible to this container.

This currently works for Nvidia devices only.

Parameters
$devices : array<string|int, mixed>
Return values
Container

export()

Writes the container as an OCI tarball to the destination file path on the host.

public export(string $path[, array<string|int, mixed>|null $platformVariants = null ][, ImageLayerCompression|null $forcedCompression = null ][, ImageMediaTypes|null $mediaTypes = null ][, bool|null $expand = false ]) : string

It can also export platform variants.

Parameters
$path : string
$platformVariants : array<string|int, mixed>|null = null
$forcedCompression : ImageLayerCompression|null = null
$mediaTypes : ImageMediaTypes|null = null
$expand : bool|null = false
Return values
string

public exposedPorts() : array<string|int, mixed>

publish()

Package the container state as an OCI image, and publish it to a registry

public publish(string $address[, array<string|int, mixed>|null $platformVariants = null ][, ImageLayerCompression|null $forcedCompression = null ][, ImageMediaTypes|null $mediaTypes = null ]) : string

Returns the fully qualified address of the published image, with digest

$mediaTypes : ImageMediaTypes|null = null

rootfs()

Return a snapshot of the container's root filesystem. The snapshot can be modified then written back using withRootfs. Use that method for filesystem modifications.

public rootfs() : Directory
Return values
Directory

public stdout() : string

sync()

Forces evaluation of the pipeline in the engine.

public sync() : ContainerId

It doesn't run the default command if no exec has been set.

Return values
ContainerId

up()

Starts a Service and creates a tunnel that forwards traffic from the caller's network to that service.

public up([bool|null $random = false ][, array<string|int, mixed>|null $ports = null ][, array<string|int, mixed>|null $args = null ][, bool|null $useEntrypoint = false ][, bool|null $experimentalPrivilegedNesting = false ][, bool|null $insecureRootCapabilities = false ][, bool|null $expand = false ][, bool|null $noInit = false ]) : void

Be sure to set any exposed ports before calling this api.

withExec()

Execute a command in the container, and return a new snapshot of the container state after execution.

public withExec(array<string|int, mixed> $args[, bool|null $useEntrypoint = false ][, string|null $stdin = '' ][, string|null $redirectStdin = '' ][, string|null $redirectStdout = '' ][, string|null $redirectStderr = '' ][, ReturnType|null $expect = null ][, bool|null $experimentalPrivilegedNesting = false ][, bool|null $insecureRootCapabilities = false ][, bool|null $expand = false ][, bool|null $noInit = false ]) : Container
Parameters
$args : array<string|int, mixed>
$useEntrypoint : bool|null = false
$stdin : string|null = ''
$redirectStdin : string|null = ''
$redirectStdout : string|null = ''
$redirectStderr : string|null = ''
$expect : ReturnType|null = null
$experimentalPrivilegedNesting : bool|null = false
$insecureRootCapabilities : bool|null = false
$expand : bool|null = false
$noInit : bool|null = false
Return values
Container

withExposedPort()

Expose a network port. Like EXPOSE in Dockerfile (but with healthcheck support)

public withExposedPort(int $port[, NetworkProtocol|null $protocol = null ][, string|null $description = null ][, bool|null $experimentalSkipHealthcheck = false ]) : Container

Exposed ports serve two purposes:

  • For health checks and introspection, when running services

  • For setting the EXPOSE OCI field when publishing the container

Parameters
$port : int
$protocol : NetworkProtocol|null = null
$description : string|null = null
$experimentalSkipHealthcheck : bool|null = false
Return values
Container

withServiceBinding()

Establish a runtime dependency from a container to a network service.

public withServiceBinding(string $alias, ServiceId|Service $service) : Container

The service will be started automatically when needed and detached when it is no longer needed, executing the default command if none is set.

The service will be reachable from the container via the provided hostname alias.

The service dependency will also convey to any files or directories produced by the container.

Parameters
$alias : string
$service : ServiceId|Service
Return values
Container

public withSymlink(string $target, string $linkName[, bool|null $expand = false ]) : Container
Parameters
$target : string
$linkName : string

Return values
Container

withWorkdir()

Change the container's working directory. Like WORKDIR in Dockerfile.

public withWorkdir(string $path[, bool|null $expand = false ]) : Container
Parameters
$path : string
$expand : bool|null = false
Return values
Container

workdir()

Retrieves the working directory for all commands.

public workdir() : string
Return values
string
